page.title: 20EAST WITTERING FIRE STATION
page.content: Our local fire station is manned by part-time firemen.They are called out about twice a week,and some weeks as many as four times,and up to a hundred times a year.There are eight part-time firemen at East Wittering and,usually, six of them go out on a call.The fire station was built in 1947.Previously the appliance was kept in a shed near the Village Hall and,before that,it was kept in the open. The most busy time for the firemen is in the Summer when everything is so dry,or at the beginning of Autumn when people begin to light their fires without first having the chimney cleaned. They are called out on all sorts emergencies including fires,home emergencies and road accidents.
